name: Koxia and Sequence
description:
Mari has three integers 
    n
, 
    x
, and 
    y
. Call an array 
    a

of 
    n
 non-negative integers good if it satisfies the following
conditions: 
    a_1+a_2+
    …+a_n=x
, and 
    a_1 
      | 
      a_2 
      |
    
     
    …
      | 
      a_n=y
, where 
    |
 denotes the bitwise OR
operation. The score of a good array is the value of 
    a_1 
    ⊕ a_2
    
    ⊕
    …
    ⊕ a_n
, where 
    ⊕
 denotes the bitwise
XOR operation. Koxia wants you to find the total bitwise XOR of the scores of
all good arrays. If there are no good arrays, output 
    0
 instead. Input
The first line of input contains three integers 
    n
, 
    x
 and 
    y

(
    1 
    ≤ n < 2^40
, 
    0 
    ≤ x < 2^60
, 
    0 
    ≤ y <
    2^20
). Output Output a single integer — the total bitwise XOR of the
scores of all good arrays. Examples Input 3 5 3 Output 2 Input 100 0 100
Output 0 Input 79877974817 749875791743978 982783 Output 64 Note In the first
test case, there are 
    12
 good arrays totally as follows. 
    [0,2,3]
,

    [0,3,2]
, 
    [2,0,3]
, 
    [2,3,0]
, 
    [3,0,2]
 and 
    [3,2,0]
 —
the score is 
    0 
    ⊕ 2 
    ⊕ 3 = 1
; 
    [1, 2, 2]
, 
    [2, 1,
    2]
 and 
    [2, 2, 1]
 — the score is 
    1 
    ⊕ 2 
    ⊕ 2 = 1
;

    [1, 1, 3]
, 
    [1, 3, 1]
 and 
    [3, 1, 1]
 — the score is 
    1
    
    ⊕ 1 
    ⊕ 3 = 3
. Therefore, the total bitwise xor of the scores
is 
    1 
    ⊕
    …
    ⊕ 1_9
     times
    ⊕ 3 
    ⊕ 3 
    ⊕ 3 = 2
. In the second test case, there are no
good sequences. The output should be 
    0
.
